Can we determine the original vector \\( z_0 \\) at \\( t = 0 \\) after observing \\( z(t) \\) at \\( t = T \\) without knowing whether \\( g(z) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without knowing if the transformation \\( g(z) \\) was applied, it's unclear if the observed \\( z(T) \\) has been altered by the phase shift \\( e^{iBT} \\). The transformation can significantly change the initial state, and without this knowledge, one cannot uniquely trace back to \\( z_0 \\) especially if \\( B \\) significantly alters the trajectory.
